posts.title: Prime factors
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return an array for prime factors of a numberexample:primeFactors(69);// [3, 23]
posts.text: Write a function to return an array for prime factors of a numberexample:primeFactors(69);// [3, 23]

posts.title: Is a prime number
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return boolean for checking if it is a prime number.
posts.text: Write a function to return boolean for checking if it is a prime number.

posts.title: Reorder an array with given indexes
posts.excerpt: We have an array of objects A and an array of indexes B. Reorder objects in array A with given indexes in array B. Do not change array A’s length.example:var A = [C, D, E, F, G];var B = [3, 0, 4, 1, 2];sort(A, B);// A is now [D, F, G, C, E];
posts.text: We have an array of objects A and an array of indexes B. Reorder objects in array A with given indexes in array B. Do not change array A’s length.example:var A = [C, D, E, F, G];var B = [3, 0, 4, 1, 2];sort(A, B);// A is now [D, F, G, C, E];

posts.title: Pascal's triangle
posts.excerpt: Write a function to return the nth row in Pascal’s triangleFor example,getRow(1) returns 1getRow(2) returns 1 1getRow(3) returns 1 2 1getRow(4) returns 1 3 3 1
posts.text: Write a function to return the nth row in Pascal’s triangleFor example,getRow(1) returns 1getRow(2) returns 1 1getRow(3) returns 1 2 1getRow(4) returns 1 3 3 1

posts.title: The First Post
posts.text: My very first post The repository for this blog Quick StartClone$ git clone https://github.com/narr/blog.git Install$ npm install Run development server$ npm run server Open a browser on localhost:8080 Deploy to Github$ npm run deploy Ref. hexo hexo-theme-icarus
